creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
description: blue and white plate; European lady musician accompanied by two gentlemen in outdoor setting; border of eight petal-shaped landscape panels
text: This is one of the earliest examples of the use of an identified European print source used in the design of Chinese export porcelain. "The Music Party" was drawn by Robert Bonnart, II and engraved by his brother, Nicolas Bonnart. The musicians wear Western costume, but are surrounded by idyllic scenes of rural China.
title: "The Concert" dish
